column1: Communication Studies: Digital Media in Europe
column3: Faculty of Social Sciences and Solvay Business School
column5: Are you intrigued by the evolution of media and communication within the European Union? This master's programme offers a unique and interdisciplinary perspective, enabling you to delve into the realms of business, policy, and user dynamics in the realm of new media. Explore your possibilities today!About the programmeHow do new media affect our lives as citizens and consumers? How are European businesses impacted? Do they really suffer from the domination of American platform giants like Google, Amazon, Facebook, and Apple? Can policymakers protect our privacy as citizens? How do media and new media affect democratic processes? These are just a few of the questions that we'll tackle in our 5 mandatory courses.
